page.title: 05INDUSTRY in THUNDRIDGE cont.
page.content: Davies Magnet have established an export market to New Zealand and the Far East.British contracts include work for the Ministry of Defence and large motor companies like Fords.They would like to take on more work in Europe but have to meet the required specifications and this takes time. The cost of fifth wheel couplings range from 270pounds to 1300pounds and the firm gives discounts of anything up to 40%.The company use their own material specifications and are governed on what materials they use by the Society of Motor Manufacturers and Traders. They employ 48 people of which eight are apprentices who are trained on the site.Every employee lives in the local area.The factory is sited next to the A10 so has easy access to the main trunk roads for supply and deliveries.
